materials.raw_text: Co: 7 g, Er: 5 g, Fe: 12 g, P: 12 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt powder) - Chemical supply store; Er (Erbium oxide) - Rare earth metals supplier; Fe (Iron powder) - Metal supply store; P (Phosphorus powder) - Chemical supply store.
steps: Co (Cobalt powder) - Chemical supply store; Er (Erbium oxide) - Rare earth metals supplier; Fe (Iron powder) - Metal supply store; P (Phosphorus powder) - Chemical supply store.

1. Weigh out each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine 7 g of Co, 5 g of Er, 12 g of Fe, and 12 g of P. 3. Mix thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer until uniform.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine 7 g of Co, 5 g of Er, 12 g of Fe, and 12 g of P. 3. Mix thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer until uniform.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1200 °C for 2 hours to ensure proper reaction and sintering of the material. 3. Maintain a nitrogen atmosphere to prevent oxidation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1200 °C for 2 hours to ensure proper reaction and sintering of the material. 3. Maintain a nitrogen atmosphere to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Allow the crucible to cool inside the furnace to room temperature over a period of 6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has fully cooled to prevent exposure to air.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Allow the crucible to cool inside the furnace to room temperature over a period of 6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has fully cooled to prevent exposure to air.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Grind the surface lightly with sandpaper to remove any irregularities. 3. If desired, apply a sealing agent to enhance surface finish and protect the material.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Grind the surface lightly with sandpaper to remove any irregularities. 3. If desired, apply a sealing agent to enhance surface finish and protect the material.
